page.description: Transform child/parent pairs into a tree.
page.syntax: Tree_List as C = *TREE_FROM_DEPENDENCIES(C data[,C format[,C separator]])

argument.name: Tree_List
argument.description: Data formatted to populate a tree control.

argument.name: format
argument.description:
A character string that defines how to parse each line in Tree_List for the parent and child data. Format must contain 'P' and 'C' placeholders to designate the parent and child. For example, if the data in Format is of the form parent|child, then Format should be P|C.
"P" = parent value,
"C" = child value

argument.name: separator
argument.description: Optional. Default = CR-LF. The separator between pairs of parent-child values.

page.discussion: The *TREE_FROM_DEPENDENCIES() function transforms parent-child pairs of values into a format suitable for displaying in a tree control. This function is useful for taking hierarchical information that is stored in a flat table (i.e. shared keys representing parent and child) and populating a tree control with that data.
